What to do for fun

Dorm Life
Academic Rigor
Tips for prospective students
In three sentences
Comments
Many lights are lit throughout campus at night as well as Security Guards available to walk students places if wanted.
The Sororities & Fraternities get greatly involved in activities around campus raising money for the group as well as charities & the school.
There are many types of clubs, so I can't even begin to list. I'm confident that anyone would be able to find one though that complements their interests.
Engineer Majors Art Majors Fashion Majors

A couple that particularly jumped out at me was all of the fashion shows of student work & the naked marathon run. There's also sayings around campus such as Minnesota Nice that are common around students.

Since many businesses look to Stout first for graduates to fill jobs, the chance of getting a job right out of school is actually pretty good. Stout has high respect for its top majors, so businesses know where to go for top prospects.
Athletic clubs, clubs that have to do with your major, school picnics & carnivals, 5k's, free concerts, grocery bingo, etc.
The cafeteria food is so much better than my high school food, plus it's basically unlimited.

Every floor/cube has its own Residant Advisor who is there for any questions you may have about school & is there as a friend if you need one if you're going through a difficult time. Plus, he/she plans activities for your group do to together, such as: ice cream parties, movie parties, tie dye t-shirts, etc.
The staff sincerely wants you to succeed, but pushes you to do your best at the same time.

Dive into extra curricular activities, do not be shy. Meeting new people is essential to going to Stout, it's such a small world there, once you know a few people, it seems like everyone is connected.

I would rate the UW-Stout an 8/10. They are always readily available to help students with any questions about the university & the staff truly cares about how their student in their classes. The school also has many activities for the students & promote a positive attitude.
pageTitle: University of Wisconsin-Stout (UW-Stout) Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {67008=the memorial student center was just renovated and reopened in 2012. it's where you'll find a majority of people hanging out on any given day., 33131=Stout is a polytechnic university and thus is great for students looking for hands on opportunities. Stout is known for technology, engineering, and arts (mostly digital). Anyone looking to go into one of these fields should consider Stout. If you like learning by doing this is great school for you. All of my classes have been so much more than lectures, everyone gets involved. Even typical lecture classes such as English are more like group discussions and we typically work in small groups on projects. Also with Stout you get small class sizes. My largest class has been speech and that only had about 25 students in it. Also, I thought I should note that for the next school year (2010-2011) Stout is going smoke-free. Smoking will be banned on the entire campus. Currently its banned in any buildings and within 25 feet of entrances to buildings., 290996=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC}

textAfterTable: Am learning a lot I have actually learned so much here at Stout. I took classes that I thought I wouldn't learn anything in and ended up learning so many things that will help me in the future. I also think Stout has a great learning environment. My classes were not very big and I always felt free to ask any questions. Login to rate or flag the reviews Danielle from Hastings, MN 07/06/2009 Reviewer is A past student here. 6 out of 6 people found this review useful. 3 of 65 Categories Comments Great for these types of students This is a great school for students who like small communities and incredibly nice people! All of the professors and students at stout are so nice and welcoming. I've never met so many great people! Students who are involved with their schools will fit well with Stout seeing as they have many opportunities for getting involved. Menomonie is a very fun town!
